titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Moses F. Little Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 4, 2019 at 04:29

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: A collection of 58 journals recording 72 years of Moses Little's life. He spent 1844-1848 aboard the whaler Arnolda , commanded by Captain D. U. Coffin out of New Bedford, Massachusetts. In 1849, Little joined the Sagamore Mining and Trading Company of Lynn, Massachusetts, and traveled to California, returning in 1851. Making a second trip to California in 1852 via the Isthmus to Panama City, he sailed on the Tennessee . He staked a claim in Sandy Gulch, Calaveras County, and returned to New York in 1853. Except for his trips to Chicago in 1869 visiting the stockyards and 1893 for the World's Fair, the remaining journals concern Little's life in Hill, New Hampshire, where he ran a general store and became interested in local politics.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Goodspeed's Book Shop, Inc.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Moses F. Little Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Moses F. Little Papers. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The information in this finding aid was derived from a description and list prepared by Goodspeed's Book Shop, Inc.

bioghist.head: Moses F. Little
bioghist.p: Moses F. Little was born on August 31, 1823, in Boscawen, New Hampshire, and lived most of his life in the small town of Hill nearby. After graduating from an academy in Salisbury, New Hampshire, and receiving a certificate to teach in district schools, he spent the years 1844 to 1848 on a whaling voyage, and 1849 to 1853 mining for gold in California. Following his return to Hill, he became a shopkeeper, and served as town clerk and justice of the peace.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of fifty-eight journals recording seventy-two years of Moses Little's life. He spent 1844-1848 aboard the whaler Arnolda , commanded by Captain D. U. Coffin out of New Bedford, Massachusetts. In 1849, Little joined the Sagamore Mining and Trading Company of Lynn, Massachusetts, and traveled to California over the plains and Rockies to Sacramento, returning in 1851. Making a second trip to California in 1852 via the Isthmus to Panama City, he sailed on the Tennessee . He staked a claim in Sandy Gulch, Calaveras County, and returned to New York via Nicaragua in 1853. Except for his trips to Chicago in 1869 visiting the stockyards and 1893 for the World's Fair, the remaining journals concern Little's life in Hill, New Hampshire, where he ran a general store, and became interested in local politics.

did.unittitle: Journal of the whaling voyage on ship Arnolda to the Pacific
Copies of 8 letters written during whaling voyage
Journal of overland travel from Lynn, Massachusetts over Oregon Trail and through South Pass, and mining in California
Diary at home, description of California flora and fauna in the back
Diary of second trip to California via isthmus of Panama and mining in California
Book of expenses at Sandy Gulch gold mine
Diary of mining in California and voyage home via Nicaragua
Diary: trip to World's Fair in Chicago
